title: BBC Local Live: Herefordshire and Worcestershire Friday 1 July 2016 - BBC News
summary: bromsgrove-born poet sir geoffrey hill dies .
petition against planned children 's services cuts .
services mark 100 years since battle of the somme .
'anger ' over dean ryan 's departure from warriors .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: watch : sunny spells and showers tomorrow
text: another day of sunny spells and showers , tomorrow .
these will move through quite quickly on the brisk westerly wind but they will be heavy at times .
feeling rather cool in the breeze .
minimum temperature tonight : 7c ( 45f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: somme centenary : thousands pay tribute
text: thousands of people across the midlands have marked the 100th anniversary of the start of the battle of the somme .
the campaign in france lasted five months with the british suffering almost 60,000 casualties on the first day alone .
there 's more on midlands today from 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Cath Mackie
BBC News Online

documents.title: train travel warning for the weekend
text: rail passengers are being warned about replacement buses in parts of worcestershire this weekend .
buses replace trains between # malvern , # colwall , # ledbury & # hereford this weekend >

documents.title: councillor to wing walk - despite never being on a plane before
text: a 76-year-old woman from worcestershire is going to perform a wing-walk at 130 mph - despite never having even been on a plane before .
little malvern and welland parish councillor mary purser will take on the challenge later this month to raise money for childline .
ms purser said : `` i 've never been in a plane , on a plane , anywhere near a plane .
`` i have no idea what it 's going to be like .
it 'll be a bit of fun .
`` i decided i would do something before i pop my clogs . ''
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: worcester rapids lose captain mitchell in first over
text: worcestershire rapids have just started their t20 blast clash against derbyshire at new road and are already one wicket down , with captain daryl mitchell going for 0 .
the home side have been in great form in the t20 competition , but recently had to battle to rescue their county champion match against derbyshire .
worcestershire are currently 1-1 .
follow live commentary online and on 738am .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: bromsgrove-born poet sir geoffrey hill dies
text: bromsgrove-born poet sir geoffrey hill has died aged 84 , his wife has confirmed .
alice goodman said her husband died `` suddenly , and without pain or dread '' on thursday evening .
sir geoffrey was the professor of poetry at oxford university until last year , and best known for mercian hymns , his 1971 collection of prose poems .
jacqueline norton , senior commissioning editor for literature at oxford university press , praised his `` poetic genius '' .
please pray for the repose of the soul of my husband , geoffrey hill , who died yesterday evening , suddenly , and without pain or dread .
that would have been jeremy .
i shall indeed .
i am so very sorry .
prayers and love from washington street .
thank you so much , john .
g and i were just wondering how you were the other day .
hope all is well .
all is well !
lucas and carl starting careers , louis looking at colleges , grace preparing for bhs , rena & i enjoying it all .
amazing !
love from me and bertie to you all .
i 'm sorry we have been so bad at keeping up our friendship .
you are dear to us , as to g .
we feel much the same .
it 's hard to stay in touch ( even with the wonders of social media ) - but good when it happens .
love .
sorry , i 'm giulia 's mom .
she does n't answer .
do you know if alla is going well ?
all is well .
i 'm in touch with alberta .
also , they posted a lovely
to have had the chance to know him , if only briefly , was an education i will forever treasure .
aw , thanks , jim .
that 's lovely of you to say .
he remembered you with affection .
and all your corridor up in uni .
i 'm so sorry for your loss , alice .
geoffrey was an amazingly gifted man !
my thoughts are with you and your family < 3
so sad to hear the news !
i am a chinese translator of his poems .
my deep condolences to you and your family .
my godmother 's husband , john bourne , an old friend of your husband , would like to know details of his funeral , please .
a good death is a gift , he was a gift , you were a gift to him i know .
[ requiescat in pace , il migglio fabbro ]
the thoughts and prayers of so many are with you .
author: BBC Entertainment and Arts

author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: crews tackle bromsgrove house fire
text: firefighters tackled a house fire on dovecote road in bromsgrove earlier today .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: inside wyre forest 's new multimillion-pound leisure centre
text: take a glimpse inside wyre forest 's new multimillion-pound leisure centre ahead of its opening .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: man wanted in connection with assault and criminal damage in redditch
text: police are looking for a man wanted in connection with assault and criminal damage in redditch .
the first incident was between 20:00 and 20:39 on 14 may outside some shops on mount pleasant .
the second was at a property in flanders close on 26 may .
keith patrick langton , 34 , from redditch , is wanted in connection with these incidents .
he is described as white , about 5 ' 11 '' tall , of a medium build with short brown hair .
author: West Mercia Police

documents.title: latest : man questioned over jamelia racial abuse and hereford woman discovers family 's tragic ww1 past
text: - a man has been questioned after singer jamelia claimed she was racially abused
- kidderminster leisure centre demolished
- herefordshire woman discovers her family 's tragic ww1 past
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: police deny officer racially abused jamelia
text: west mercia police say an officer was not responsible for alleged racial abuse suffered by popstar jamelia during a confrontation in worcestershire .

the singer said a man who appeared to be a police officer used a racial slur in front of her daughters during an angry exchange that left her `` feeling scared '' , after she overtook him in hewell lane , barnt green on monday .
west mercia police say a 56-year-old man is being interviewed in connection with the incident , but was not under arrest
the investigation continues .
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: whistles mark the moment men went over the top in somme
text: commemorations are taking place across britain and france to remember the 100th anniversary of the start of the battle of the somme .
at worcester cathedral whistles were blown to mark the moment the first british soldiers went over the top of their trenches .
leader of the city council , adrian gregson blew the whistle , he said : `` there were eight battalions of the worcestershire regiment that had taken part .
they lost something like 4,000 men .
`` you can argue all you like about whether the tactics were right and how the overall war itself went .
`` you ca n't erase the fact that we lost 60,000 men on one day - that 's a big football stadium . ''
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: midlands business leaders expect the unexpected
text: my latest blog post takes the temperature among midlands decision-makers at the launch event for the west midlands combined authority .
the atmosphere was s of course by the brexit vote .
lord heseltine was the star attraction , but i spent plenty of time mingling with the men and women at the sharp end of economic decision-making during the lunch and coffee breaks .
their mood was , above all , uncertain .
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: cricket : worcestershire 's director frustrated over abandoned match
text: `` it 's washed out what i think would have been a fine game but we ca n't do anything about the english summer , '' said worcestershire county cricket club 's steve rhodes .
he was frustrated but philosophical after his team 's natwest t20 blast match at durham jets on thursday was abandoned in the 15th over with worcestershire on 103-5 .
the rapids will be back in action tonight when they will take on derbyshire falcons at new road , worcester where play is due to start at 17:30 .
there will be full commentary on that game on 738 am and online .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: travel : car crash shuts one lane on m5 in worcester
text: a car crash has closed one lane on the m5 between j8 for m50 worcestershire and j7 for a44 worcester .
there are also delays northbound between j4a for the m42 and j6 for the a449 , due to a broken down vehicle .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: planners give go-ahead for two new units at worcester six
text: construction of two large industrial units could soon get underway at a key site near worcester after planners gave the development alongside the m5 the green light .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: end of an era as leisure centre demolished
text: it 's the end of an era this week - as a 30-year-old leisure centre in kidderminster is demolished .
the wyre forest glades leisure centre - which was opened by princess diana - is to be relocated on the kidderminster to stourport road in the town next week .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: latest : services mark 100 years since battle of the somme ; woman denies stealing dog
text: here are some of the stories we are looking at in the hereford & worcester newsroom this afternoon :
- services mark 100 years since the battle of the somme
- woman denies stealing a dog from outside a supermarket
- petition against children 's services cuts
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: roof cut off car after worcester city centre crash
text: the roof had to be cut from a car to get to the casualty following a crash involving two cars in the centre of worcester this morning .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: bromyard man 's pride at father 's somme battle
text: the son of a soldier who survived the battle of the somme has spoken of his pride on its centenary .
neil parker 's father percy volunteered in 1915 and went on to become a farmer contractor and butcher in bromyard .
neil said : `` when folks talk about it i can say 'my dad was out there ' and my son nigel can say 'my grandfather was out there ' .
`` my father was very proud of bromyard .
he always used to say if you want to find a mug in bromyard you 've got to bring him with you . ''
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: watch : weather forecast for the west midlands
text: the showers are expected to become more widespread through the day , some turning heavy and thundery , with the added risk of hail .
feeling cool in the fresh winds .
maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: alarm fault sees redditch shopping centre evacuated
text: shoppers and staff have been evacuated from the kingfisher shopping centre in redditch this morning .
three malls were closed after an alarm was set off .
a spokesman for the centre told bbc hereford and worcester it was all down to a technical fault and people only had to stay outside for a few minutes .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: battle of the somme : the mother who lost three sons in ww1
text: thousands of soldiers fought and died alongside their own fathers , brothers and cousins on the bloody battlefield of the somme .
decades later , the discovery of locks of hair in a drawer led one woman to discover the tragic story of her family 's past .
miranda michels always wondered about the soft and glossy golden ringlets she found as a girl in a trinket box hidden in the dark recesses of her grandmother 's desk .
the precious keepsakes were the key to unlocking the story of the wilmot brothers , robert , cecil and tom - who were all killed in world war one - and larry and ned , who survived .

documents.title: woman accused of stealing dog from outside hereford supermarket
text: a 36-year-old woman has pleaded not guilty to stealing a dog which was tied up outside asda in hereford .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: tragic end to friendship for neighbours who fought side by side in the somme
text: today marks the centenary of the battle of the somme which saw more than one million men killed or wounded during five months of fighting .
percy parker bill adams were neighbours from bromyard who volunteered together and fought next to each other on the somme - until bill was killed by a shell .
percy survived and became a farmer , contractor and butcher in bromyard
percy 's son neil told bbc hereford & worcester his father did not want to talk about what had happened .
`` he would have been stood by bill and a shell came over and killed bill outright .
`` they joined together and had consecutive numbers . ''
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: rugby union : worcester warriors fans angry at director 's departure
text: worcester warriors ' chief executive jim o'toole says he can understand some supporters being angry about the departure of dean ryan from sixways .
the director of rugby will be replaced by head coach carl hogg and high performance director nick johnston .
mr o'toole said : `` there is fall out , people see both sides of it .
there has been an emotional reaction .
a club does get personalised into one person because they 've been the media figurehead but this club is not about one person . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: worcester heritage and independent shops in the spotlight
text: the city council 's leader says he wants to spark a fresh tourism push - focusing on worcester 's heritage and independent shops .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: planned children 's services cuts come under fire
text: a petition against cuts to children 's services , signed by more than 600 parents in worcestershire is being handed into worcestershire county council today .
the local authority is looking to change the way it helps young families through its 32 centres .
as part of that it needs to save £ 1.5m by next year , which it accepts may well mean fewer staff to help families
the council 's plans are being discussed at a special scrutiny meeting this morning .
author: Matthew Bone
Political reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: services mark battle of the somme centenary
text: people across herefordshire and worcestershire have joined a two-minute silence this morning to mark the centenary of the battle of the somme .
in all , more than one million men were killed or wounded during the five-month battle .
a special commemoration took place at worcester cathedral which began with the blowing of a whistle - the sound that led thousands of young men to their deaths 100 years ago today .

documents.title: news : people remember somme centenary ; parents warning over children 's services ' cuts ; anger over ryan leaving worcester warriors
text: this morning 's headlines include :
- people across herefordshire and worcestershire are remembering the centenary of the start of the battle of the somme today
- hundreds of parents are warning worcestershire county council that they think young families will suffer from new cuts to the county 's children 's services
- worcester warriors ' chief executive jim o'toole says he can understand some supporters being angry about the departure of dean ryan from sixways
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: watch : latest weather for the west midlands
text: a showery day with gusty winds .
the showers will become more widespread through the day , some turning heavy and thundery , with the added risk of hail .
feeling cool in the fresh winds .

author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning - welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to herefordshire and worcestershire live on friday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid message via facebook .
